alert.note: Alert for Logan; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 1:36AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wyoming and southeastern Logan Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 135 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mallory, or 11 miles southeast of Logan, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oceana, Man, Mallory, Amherstdale-Robinette, Clear Fork, Kopperston, Amherstdale-Robine, Cyclone, Coal Mountain and Switzer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause elevated levels on small creeks and streams, and ponding of water on country roads and farmland along the banks of creeks and streams.
